body:
On a failing worker, I see the following  (port_server.py PID =79048):

```
$lsof -Pan -p 79048 -i
COMMAND   PID    USER   FD   TYPE             DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME
Python  79048 jenkins    4u  IPv4 0xb9653d03c2703c25      0t0  TCP *:32767 (LISTEN)
Python  79048 jenkins    8u  IPv4 0xb9653d03d3791c25      0t0  TCP 127.0.0.1:32767->127.0.0.1:54669 (ESTABLISHED)

$lsof -i :32767
COMMAND   PID    USER   FD   TYPE             DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME
Python  79048 jenkins    4u  IPv4 0xb9653d03c2703c25      0t0  TCP *:filenet-powsrm (LISTEN)
Python  79048 jenkins    8u  IPv4 0xb9653d03d3791c25      0t0  TCP localhost:filenet-powsrm->localhost:54669 (ESTABLISHED)
Python  91071 jenkins    7u  IPv4 0xb9653d03b74bbf65      0t0  TCP localhost:52495->localhost:filenet-powsrm (SYN_SENT)
```

On an OK worker, I  see (port_server.py PID = 31589):

```
$lsof -Pan -p 31589 -i
COMMAND   PID    USER   FD   TYPE             DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME
Python  31589 jenkins    4u  IPv4 0x14756b120a92c7e7      0t0  TCP *:32767 (LISTEN)

$lsof -i :32767
COMMAND   PID    USER   FD   TYPE             DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME
Python  31589 jenkins    4u  IPv4 0x14756b120a92c7e7      0t0  TCP *:filenet-powsrm (LISTEN)
```

It seems we are colliding with something that is trying to connect to 32767: http://www.adminsub.net/tcp-udp-port-finder/32767

@jtattermusch @nicolasnoble  Any idea why we chose this port number in particular?

It's outside the ephemeral port range (broadly: 32768 - 65535) - which is
semi-important - we don't want the port server taking a resource it's
supposed to hand out.

Other than that, 0x7fff seemed pretty.

On Thu, Jun 30, 2016 at 2:40 PM kpayson64 notifications@github.com wrote:

> Python 31589 jenkins 4u IPv4 0x14756b120a92c7e7 0t0 TCP *:32767 (LISTEN)

> COMMAND PID USER FD TYPE DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME

> (LISTEN)

> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/7145#issuecomment-229796287, or mute
> the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/AJpudXFzOeaxWOWdiOBuAUei4-B-KQGYks5qRDcJgaJpZM4JBfaH
> .

Oh, and it needed to be different to 1234, since we had some older
incompatible port servers in the cluster running on that port.

I haven't seen this issue since the port server port change, marking resolved.

The issue looks different this time:

```
jenkinss-Mac-mini:~ jenkins$ lsof -i :32766
COMMAND     PID    USER   FD   TYPE             DEVICE SIZE/OFF NODE NAME
Python    65487 jenkins    4u  IPv4 0x9f7eeb2277710f27      0t0  TCP *:32766 (LISTEN)
Python    65487 jenkins    8u  IPv4 0x9f7eeb227c9a7657      0t0  TCP localhost:32766->localhost:49311 (ESTABLISHED)
bad_serve 85922 jenkins   11u  IPv6 0x9f7eeb226f5478d7      0t0  TCP localhost:49324->localhost:32766 (ESTABLISHED)
h2_full+t 86205 jenkins   11u  IPv6 0x9f7eeb226f614bd7      0t0  TCP localhost:49313->localhost:32766 (ESTABLISHED)
h2_full+t 86207 jenkins   11u  IPv6 0x9f7eeb2284b236d7      0t0  TCP localhost:49317->localhost:32766 (ESTABLISHED)
h2_full+t 86208 jenkins   13u  IPv6 0x9f7eeb226fa4bbd7      0t0  TCP localhost:49320->localhost:32766 (ESTABLISHED)
concurren 86768 jenkins 1079u  IPv6 0x9f7eeb22767ce1d7      0t0  TCP localhost:49322->localhost:32766 (ESTABLISHED)
```

The log file is missing too:

```
ps waux | grep port_server.py
jenkins         65487   0.0  0.1  2504736   9328   ??  Ss   Fri09AM   2:05.91 /usr/bin/python /jenkins/workspace/gRPC_pull_requests@2/config/opt/language/csharp/platform/macos/tools/run_tests/port_server.py -p 32766 -l /var/folders/g4/3ppgfd8x4274zrnf_tf60_8h0000gn/T/tmpXJiuEt

jenkinss-Mac-mini:~ jenkins$ ls -l /var/folders/g4/3ppgfd8x4274zrnf_tf60_8h0000gn/T/tmpXJiuEt
ls: /var/folders/g4/3ppgfd8x4274zrnf_tf60_8h0000gn/T/tmpXJiuEt: No such file or directory
```
